body_html:
I would try putting #if !defined() around the lines in subprocess.cc that call these functions, and put LOG(FATAL) << "fork() not available on this platform"; error messages in the #else block.

I don't believe these should be needed, so it seems reasonable to stub them out.
body_text:
I would try putting #if !defined() around the lines in subprocess.cc that call these functions, and put LOG(FATAL) << "fork() not available on this platform"; error messages in the #else block.
I don't believe these should be needed, so it seems reasonable to stub them out.
body:
I would try putting #if !defined(<macro for detecting watchos>) around the lines in subprocess.cc that call these functions, and put LOG(FATAL) << "fork() not available on this platform"; error messages in the #else block.

I don't believe these should be needed, so it seems reasonable to stub them out.
